intro: Guagnebina lutescens, commonly known as the yellow flame orchid, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the Orchidaceae family and is characterized by its vibrant yellow petals and intricate floral structure. The plant typically grows in humid, shaded environments, often in the understory of rainforests. Its roots are adapted to absorb nutrients from the rich, organic soil of its habitat. Guagnebina lutescens is valued for its ornamental beauty and plays a role in local ecosystems by providing nectar for pollinators.
